greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of n-vertex labeled simple graphs containing a Hamiltonian path.
comment: A path is Hamiltonian if it passes through every vertex exactly once.
link: F. Hüffner, tinygraph, software for generating integer sequences based on graph properties, version 9766535.
Gus Wiseman, Enumeration of paths and cycles and e-coefficients of incomparability graphs.
Gus Wiseman, The a(4) = 34 simple graphs containing a Hamiltonian path
xref: The directed case is A326214 (with loops) or A326217 (without loops).
Simple graphs without a Hamiltonian path are A326205.
Simple graphs with a Hamiltonian cycle are A326208.
results.author: _Gus Wiseman_, Jun 14 2019
ext: a(7)-a(11) added using tinygraph by _Falk Hüffner_, Jun 21 2019
